byline.contributor: Ellen Barry contributed reporting from New Delhi.

abstract: Bangladeshi authorities arrest four suspects in murder of Italian aid worker Cesare Tavella in Dhaka; investigators deny, despite claims made on social media, that Islamic State was involved in fatal shooting, maintaining crime was meant to sow political discord.
lead_paragraph: The authorities dismissed claims that the Islamic State was behind a fatal shooting in Dhaka last month, saying the motive was to “keep the government under pressure.”

headline.main: Bangladeshi Officials Say 4 Arrested in Killing of Italian Aid Worker Were Not With ISIS
headline.print_headline: Bangladeshi Officials Say 4 Arrested in Killing of Italian Aid Worker Were Not With ISIS

snippet: The authorities dismissed claims that the Islamic State was behind a fatal shooting in Dhaka last month, saying the motive was to “keep the government under pressure.”

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
